description:
First Print Limited Edition of the game is a PSP-exclusive release of the game.

The package contains:

  • Dunamis15 game
  • Original drama CD with drama titled "Celes-shou wa Kokuikkoku" (セレス荘は刻一刻)
  • Crystal ornament with 3D printed game title and a heroine
title: Dunamis15 (Shokai Genteiban)

description: Nayuta no Kiseki is an action RPG that doesn't continue the existing Kiseki game series, drops out The Legend of Heroes title prefix and creates a whole new world and characters with a whole new Kiseki game. The protagonist of the story is Nayuta Herschel, a young man whose hometown, Remnant Island, is a part of Lost Heaven world. Nayuta's passion is astrology and his aspiration is to go into the world and explore as much of it as he can, solving the world's mysteries on his journey into the unknown. For some time now, a strange phenomenon is occurring around the Remnant Island, shooting stars and debris are falling from the sky and into the surrounding sea. In one of the latest incident, a huge chunk of debris falls not far off the island coast, and Nayuta, along with his friend Signa, goes into what seems like a fallen tower to explore it. Inside they find Noi, a pink-haired fairy-tale who teams up with Nayuta. This fateful meeting is just the beginning of their long and mysterious journey together. When you are not adventuring around exploring lands and towns, visiting shops or talking to other characters, you will find yourself engaged in battle with random enemies and eventually bosses. Basic actions during battle are sword skills, art of magic, and gear craft which gives you special abilities.

sample_screenshots.caption: You've got a telescope on your roof
Exclamation mark indicates the point of interaction

title: Nayuta no Kiseki

description:
Burst Error: EVE The 1st. is a remake of EVE Burst Error, redone from scratch and without explicit adult content. While the base story of the original is used as an underlay, character design, graphics, soundtrack and voice-acting are done completely anew. There are changes in the original scenario as well as newly added scenarios and characters.

The multi-sight system, which switches view between protagonists Marina and Kojiro, is polished to work better with the new story and the way the game is presented. The game has all the main features of a visual novel game, quick save/load feature, ability to toggle the dialogue text to display the clear background with the on-screen characters, message log, multiple choices that branch the story, and lots of unlockables such as CG gallery, BGM player and concept art gallery. The game also supports installation to memory card (96.9 MB) to speed up the loading time.

sample_screenshots.caption: Marina talking to her boss in his office
Sight change system lets you switch between Marina and Kojiro

title: Burst Error: EVE The 1st.

description:
This is a Japanese exclusive compilation of early SNK games. Despite being titled Vol. 0, it is the sequel to SNK Arcade Classics Vol. 1. It contains arcade versions of:

  • Ikari Warriors
  • Ikari Warriors II: Victory Road
  • Ikari III: The Rescue
  • Athena
  • Psycho Soldier
  • Sasuke Vs Commander
  • Tank
  • Alpha Mission
  • PREHISTORIC ISLE in 1930
  • Bermuda Triangle
  • Vanguard II
  • HAL 21
  • Marvin's Maze
  • Guerrilla War
  • P.O.W.: Prisoners of War
  • Street Smart
  • SAR: Search and Rescue
  • Touchdown Fever
  • Gold Medalist
  • Super Championship Baseball (overseas version) (1989)
title: SNK Arcade Classics 0

description:
The Madden series makes its first appearance on the PSP with Madden NFL 06. Based on the concurrent console version, it adapts some of its modes for play on the handheld, removes others, and adds some unique features, including several mini games.

Gameplay modes include exhibition games, wireless head-to-head play (online or ad-hoc), practice, and franchise. Modes and features that have not made it over from the consoles include owner mode, superstar mode, Madden Cards, creating teams, or the ability to challenge plays. The new gameplay features QB vision or hit stick (due to lack of a second analog stick) are not in the PSP version either, but precision passing has made the cut. The game also features connectivity to the PS2 version: it is possible to transfer franchise games from PS2 to PSP and vice versa, allowing one to play one set of games at home and another on the road, with results available on both systems.

The Mini Camp mode from the console version has been expanded and features ten exclusive mini-games, playable either on their own or in a competition. Another PSP-exclusive feature is an assistant coach mode.
title: Madden NFL 06

description:
The Madden series returns to the PSP for a second outing with Madden NFL 07. Closely based on the previous year's iteration, it has the usual roster updates, improved loading times, and some new features.

The game adds some of the new control options introduced in the console versions, including the Hit Stick (toggled on the PSP via the triangle button) and Lead Blocker Control. The main game modes are unchanged from the previous year and include "play now" quick games, wi-fi multiplayer, mini-camp and franchise (still without Owner Mode or Storyline Central, but with the exclusive Assistant Coach mode). The PS2 connectivity option now allows to transfer entire franchise seasons between PSP and PS2. A new addition is the mini game "End 2 End". In this mode, the PSP is held vertically. A runner moves towards the end zone and faces a number of tacklers. Upon noticing the direction the tackler is going in, the player must respond by hitting the correct direction button in time to evade. Score is given for quick reaction and multiple evasions in a row. Reaching high scores in this mode unlocks music tracks and hidden teams.
title: Madden NFL 07

description:
Madden NFL 08 is the third iteration of the series on the PSP. Based closely on the previous year's version, it includes most of its modes while adding a new one, and also incorporates some of the new features seen in the console versions.

Returning modes include "play now", franchise (with a redesigned interface), practice, and mini-camp. Last year's "End 2 End" mini game is replaced by the new "Superstar Challenge" mode. It presents players with a number of real situations from games from the 2006 NFL season, asking them to replicate star players' moves like making last-minute touchdowns or long passes.

The new "weapon" system from the consoles has made it to this version, allowing players to quickly scan for mismatches at the line. Returning features are ad-hoc and online multiplayer and connectivity to the PS2 version, allowing franchises to transfer between the platforms.
title: Madden NFL 08

description: This demo version of the first Danganronpa game allows the player to experience an alternate version of the game's first chapter, with a similar setup but different characters involved in the murder, in order to avoid spoiling early plot details. The player may choose to play the chapter from the beginning, or skip directly to the Class Trial segment. However, the end of the demo is reached before the trial is fully concluded. Save data from this demo can be sent to the main game, which grants bonus Monokuma coins to the player.
title: Danganronpa: Kibō no Gakuen to Zetsubō no Kōkōsei - Taikenban

description:
Madden NFL 09 for PSP is another yearly update in the series. Regarding modes and options, it is very similar to its predecessor. Besides the usual roster updates, it introduces several features designed to make the game easier for beginners.

All game modes of the previous year return: play now, franchise, mini-camp, practice and Superstar Challenge. The challenges have been updated and now feature situations from the 2007 season. The game introduces a Rookie Mode, which simplifies controls, reducing them to a few buttons, and also introduces prompts indicating what to press when. Also considering new players, the playcalling system has been redesigned and features basic and advanced options. Another new feature is a new defensive camera, which in a break from most football games has the camera behind the defensive line, with the offense moving toward the screen.

sample_screenshots.caption: Loading screen with info and quiz
Kicking the ball after a successful touchdown.

title: Madden NFL 09

description:
After three PSP iterations of the franchise developed at EA Canada, development duties for Madden NFL 10 returned to series main developer EA Tiburon. The game features all the modes of the previous version, and also adds several new features.

Returning game modes include play now, franchise, mini-camp and practice. Superstar Challenge mode also returns (with all-new situations from the 2008 season), but offers an additional twist: in addition to playing the "Hero", players can also play the "Spoiler" and prevent the historical moments from happening. A play designer has been added that allows players to create plays and formations for use in the game's playbooks. Created plays can be uploaded to the PS3 version.

On the field, a mini-game for fumble recovery has been added, similar to the one seen in other versions: when during a fumble, both teams are in range of the ball, who gains possession is decided by a quick-time event, requiring both mashing of buttons and hitting the correct buttons in sequence. Another addition is a player momentum system: depending on their performance during a game, individual players have hot or cold streaks, influencing their further performance. The game also features newly-recorded commentary by Tom Hammond and Cris Collinsworth.
title: Madden NFL 10

description:
The Madden series returns for another season on the PSP with Madden NFL 11. Changes to the predecessor are minimal and mainly consist of roster updates, a new soundtrack and newly-recorded commentary.

All game modes return: play now, franchise, mini-camp, practice and Superstar Challenge. The challenges have been updated for the 2009 season and again allow players to play either Hero or Spoiler. The Play Designer also returns. Multiplayer is no longer available via infrastructure but ad hoc only. The commentary is provided by Gus Johnson and Cris Collingsworth.
title: Madden NFL 11

description:
A sequel to Colosseum: Road to Freedom. You once again begin your journey as a gladiator. Your best chance at freedom is to earn enough money in the arena to purchase your liberty from the shackles of servitude.

The game features real-time combat against one or multiple opponents and allies, a wide variety of equipment to buy, sell or modify as well as several different fighting styles and a branching storyline with multiple endings.
title: Gladiator Begins

description:
This Limited Edition release of Suigetsu 2 Portable (水月 弐 ～Portable～) contains:

  • Suigetsu 2 Portable PSP game
  • Five PSP stickers featuring game heroines (not compatible with PSP-1000 model)
  • PSP holding bag with game artwork
title: Suigetsu 2 Portable (Genteiban)

description:
A third-person (with an optional first-person view) action game that places you in control of a variety of Mobile Suits and Mobile Armours from the Universal Century timeline of the Gundam media franchise that started in 1979. The game features both instant action modes and a campaign mode, as well as over 200 different Mobile Suits and Mobile Armours controllable by the player as well as additional units such as spaceships that can not be directly piloted by the player.

The campaign let's you create a character, assign them factions and use them throughout several different eras of the Universal Century. In the process of doing so your pilots level up and earn points that can be used to upgrade your vehicles performance.

If one has a friend one can also help one-another out in the campaign mode by using the adhoc function of the PSP. The game also supports regular player-versus-player multiplayer options.

sample_screenshots.caption: The universe is bigger than that.
Jesus Christ, more selection to make. JUST STOP IT ALREADY.
Classic helmet. Lots of character info here.

title: Gundam Battle Universe

description:
Kidō Senshi Gundam: Senjō no Kizuna Portable is a port for the PSP based on REV1.00 of the arcade-title Kidō Senshi Gundam: Senjō no Kizuna.

The main portion of the gameplay has the player pilot one of over forty-eight different Mobile Suits of five different classes, Melee, Short Range, Mid Range, Long Range and Sniper. The two factions represented are the Earth Federation and the Principality of Zeon, with the battles taking place during the year 0079 Universal Century.

The game modes available are Arcade, Mission and Original Rule.* Arcade imitates the ruleset of the original Arcade release which has 4 vs 4 Mobile Suits compete over various capturable points in an effort to reduce the opposing team's tickets first.

  • Mission is a series of missions exclusive to the port, beginning with tutorials explaining the controls and tactics to be used in the game and then expanding into missions requiring you to use specific Mobile Suits to fulfill specific objectives.

  • Original Rule is the arcade mode but with the addition of letting the player customize a wide set of variables such as density of radar jamming, the amount of tickets, time limit and more.

As the player plays Arcade or Original Rule they earn experience in the various classes which lets them unlock new Mobile Suits. Players also have the ability to earn specific unlocks from using a specific Mobile Suit repeatedly such as new weapons and altering the performance characteristics of the unit.

The game supports up to 4 vs 4 multiplayer via the PlayStation Portable's Ad Hoc system. Infrastructure multiplayer is not supported.
title: Kidō Senshi Gundam: Senjō no Kizuna - Portable

description:
Disney•Pixar Cars 2 is a racing game based on the animated movie of the same name. The frame story is that Lightning McQueen and his friends are trained in C.H.R.O.M.E. missions, the races, in order to defeat Professor Zundapp.

The main racing event is battle mode in which the player races against opponents and collects power-ups on the way which either allow to perform offensive (machine guns) or defensive (e.g. a shield against enemy attacks) actions as well as speed boosts. There are various other variants of battle mode, including racing against the clock or elimination races. In contrast to the console/PC version, the cars are not freely controlled: the player can only jump between the lanes. The camera angle changes automatically during the race.

During the campaign the player will unlock a number of additional cars which differ in their control, power and speed ratings. Before tackling a new campaign mission, which have different difficulty levels assigned to them, the used car can be changed. The free play mode allows to choose between all racing modes.
title: Disney•Pixar Cars 2

description:
The story takes place in year 2050 and centers on Youichi Hinata, a high-school student who lost his parents in a tragic accident. Constantly hanging out with his close, yet eccentric buddy, Ginga Amamiya, the two of them are working on a project to make a rocket and launch it all the way to the moon. Foolish task for the kids, but they're serious about it in their own way. One peaceful night, while Youichi was on the phone with his childhood friend, Asuka, talking about the stars, he noticed a falling star. Not thinking too much of it at the time, after the phone call he noticed there was something different about it. It wasn't a falling star... it was something else, and it fell down nearby. He went out in the dead of night to try to locate the fallen object. On his way there, he run into Ginga and the two of them approached the park where instead of a fallen meteor, they saw a small spaceship. Not sure what sort of alien they might encounter, or if it's even alive, they opened the hatch only to see a dazed girl in place of a pilot. Seeing how Youichi is living alone, and until they figure out what to do next, they decide that Youichi should take her in for the time being. And thus the story of Youichi and Aries begins.

The story is presented in two different timelines. The present time in 2050, and two years prior the accident, in 2048. The game contains all the expected gameplay features to be found in a visual novel, such as message log with ability to skip to previous scenes or replay dialogues, quicksave and quickload options as we as regular save option with up to 99 slots, the ability to remove the text to see the clear background picture, and bonus galleries and music player. The PSP port main differences in comparison to the original release is that it has full voice-acting for non-player characters, additional episode that extends the story, and many new CG events making this port contain three times the original.

Originally released as Himawari for PC (Windows) in 2007 as adult visual novel, in 2010 the port to PSP got renamed to Himawari: Pebble in the Sky Portable. In 2011, the game got released on iOS and Android devices through three chapters, which included a bonus fandisk episode called Himawari: Aqua After. In 2012, both iOS and Android releases stopped existing as separate chapters and were integrated in a single all-chapter releases. In 2015, the PSP version was ported to PSVita as Himawari: Pebble in the Sky which included more additional content.

sample_screenshots.caption: Running into Ginga on your way to the crash site
I shouldn't have entered without knocking

title: Himawari: Pebble in the Sky Portable

description:
No Fate!: Only the Power of Will is a light visual novel that originated on PSP and Xbox 360 with a sci-fi elements and a typical gameplay system for similar games in the genre. As such it features many background CGs with on-screen characters which all have full voice-acting except for the protagonist. On-screen text may be toggled off to get better view of the background CG event. The game does not feature branching story nor multiple endings, and instead tells fairly linear story. During the dialogues, certain keywords get highlighted and added to your stock where they can be further examined to provide additional relevant information.

The story revolves around a high-school student, Takaya Takayama, who one day while searching for his notebook stumbles upon a girl from outer space. Her name is Mabel, and her space ship has disappeared and until she finds and retrieves it, she decides to stay with Takaya at his place. Thus, Takaya's life of day-to-day boring student life gets filled with lots of unexpected and vivid events, and the relationship between Takaya and Mabel slowly takes turn toward something more than just friendship.

sample_screenshots.caption: A fateful meeting with an alien girl
Key words are logged and offer further explanation

title: No Fate!: Only the Power of Will

description:
Kokoro Connect is a non-adult visual novel that originated on PSP, based on the manga and anime TV series with the same name, but featuring original scenario. This story focuses on five lead characters: Iori Nagase, Himeko Inaba, Taichi Yaegashi, Yoshifumi Aoki, and Yui Kiriyama, with scenario and full voice-acting for each of them, including the protagonist. The player takes a role of Taichi Yaegashi, a student in a Shiritsuyamahoshi (私立山星) high-school, and a member of a Culture Research Club. After a strange incident with cardiospermum halicacabum plant, the member of the Culture Research Club started to experience strange premonitions. During those premonitions, they would appear at the random place, with the random people at random time, often finding themselves in a situation very different from their reality.

During the course of the story, point of view jumps from character to character, and their actions and choices branch the story toward one of the multiple endings. The game also features story graph which shows you which direction you took, where did you story branch, and at which point in the story you currently are. Events in the story can be re-played with the point of view from multiple characters. Aside from that, the bulk of the game still consists of the same elements that make a visual novel game what it is... visual (CG events with anime character art on top of background location art) and novel (text window during storytelling and fully voice-acted dialogues). Unlockable bonus content such as event scene galleries and music player, can be accessed via main menu.

This initial retail release, unlike the digital release, comes with several bonuses inside the package:

  • Voucher for downloading 10 PSP themes and a playable bonus scenario
  • Culture Research Club newspaper (two-sided A4 size)
  • Collectible card featuring game character

The voucher for downloading bonus content was valid only from October 18, 2012 until October 18, 2013.

sample_screenshots.caption: Main character also features full voice acting
Talking to Nakayama, one of your classmates

title: Kokoro Connect: Yochi Random

description:
L@ve Once (read as "love at once") is a romance visual novel that tells the story of a boy called Shouji Takanashi (高梨 翔司) whose mother is a mermaid. He met mermaids as a small child but forgot about them. One day, his father passes away and not long after, two sisters, who happen to be mermaids as well, come to his place. Their names are Mei and Meru. Being a son of a mermaid, he can only fall in love once, as broken heart would be the end of him. With the help of Mei and Meru, he will hopefully be able to find his true love.

The game originated on PSP and is a light visual novel without any adult content. A year later the game was ported to PS3 with some changes and additional content under the title L@ve Once: Mermaid's Tears. Both platforms have limited edition releases which feature bonus content such as audio drama, artbook or soundtrack.

sample_screenshots.caption: Reminiscing your first encounter with two mermaids, Mei and Mel

title: L@ve Once

description:
Shokai Genteiban release of L@ve Once game comes with this bonus content:

  • Special guide book
  • Soundtrack
title: L@ve Once (Shokai Genteiban)

description:
THE iDOLM@STER SP is a sub-series of three PSP games from THE iDOLM@STER series. Like previous games, they are raising simulation and rhythm games. The player assumes the role of a producer who manages pop idols for 765 Production. Each game has different idols and storylines. In Story mode, unlike previous games, only one idol may be produced at a time. A rival studio is introduced, 961 Production. In Free mode, gameplay is more traditional, with 52 weeks to build up the idol of choice. Office mode allows the player to play around with any idol, with features like sound test and changing costumes. Downloadable content is also available.

In Perfect Sun, the available idols are Haruka Amami, Makoto Kikuchi, and Yayoi Takatsuki. The rival idol from 961 Project Fairy is series newcomer Hibiki Ganaha.
title: THE iDOLM@STER SP: Perfect Sun

description:
THE iDOLM@STER SP is a sub-series of three PSP games from THE iDOLM@STER series. Like previous games, they are raising simulation and rhythm games. The player assumes the role of a producer who manages pop idols for 765 Production. Each game has different idols and storylines. In Story mode, unlike previous games, only one idol may be produced at a time. A rival studio is introduced, 961 Production. In Free mode, gameplay is more traditional, with 52 weeks to build up the idol of choice. Office mode allows the player to play around with any idol, with features like sound test and changing costumes. Downloadable content is also available.

In Wandering Star, the available idols are Yukiho Hagiwara, Iori Minase, and Ami and Mami Futami. The rival idol from 961 Project Fairy is series newcomer Takane Shijou.
title: The iDOLM@STER SP: Wandering Star

description:
THE iDOLM@STER SP is a sub-series of three PSP games from THE iDOLM@STER series. Like previous games, they are raising simulation and rhythm games. The player assumes the role of a producer who manages pop idols for 765 Production. Each game has different idols and storylines. In Story mode, unlike previous games, only one idol may be produced at a time. A rival studio is introduced, 961 Production. In Free mode, gameplay is more traditional, with 52 weeks to build up the idol of choice. Office mode allows the player to play around with any idol, with features like sound test and changing costumes. Downloadable content is also available.

In Missing Moon, the available idols are Chihaya Kisaragi, Azusa Miura, and Ritsuko Akizuki. The rival idol from 961 Project Fairy is Miki Hoshii, who left 765 Production and joined the rival company.
title: The iDOLM@STER SP: Missing Moon

description: Phase D: Kurosei no Shō is the third chapter in the four-volume Phase D sci-fi visual novel series. There are four phases of human existence. From conception to birth is called Phase A. From birth to death is called Phase B. From death to disappearance of the corpse is Phase C. And last, remnant after the death, separate from the corpse, is referred to as Phase D. Protagonist in this chapter is a young woman, Sachika Kuze (久世幸花) and the story revolves around her as she starts to uncover the strange power she possesses. This visual novel plays in a typical way by progressing the dialogue text (manually or on auto), showing the text at the bottom part of the background image. The game features full voice-acting for in-game characters.
title: Phase D: Kurosei no Shō

description:
Genteiban (限定版) release of Sorairo Portable for PSP includes:

  • Sorairo Portable game
  • Audio drama CD containing separate episodes for each of the three heroines: Ai (愛衣), Tsubame (つばめ) and Hanako (花子)
  • 32-page A5 format special booklet with character info, artwork, map, making-of, illustrations, and interviews
title: Sorairo Portable (Genteiban)

description:
R.U.R.U.R: Petit Prince is a non-adult port of a PC (Windows) adult visual novel title originally known as R.U.R.U.R: Kono Ko no Tame ni, Semete Kirei na Hoshizora wo. To compensate on removed adult contents, this PlayStation Portable port features additional scenario with new CG events, as well as a new character.

The player takes the role of Ichihiko, a young boy living in a seemingly perfect world with no worries. What he doesn't know is that everything around him is fake. His sisters are in fact robots, his life is perfectly scheduled to appease him, and he is in fact the last living human. And he is starting to uncover the truth behind his life, partially thanks to some of the robots that would like to lift this veil of deception and tell him the truth.

sample_screenshots.caption: R-Shirotsumegusa is engrossed in hear reading
Your "sisters" are all dressed and ready for school

title: R.U.R.U.R: Petit Prince

description:
Suigetsu 2 Portable is a romance visual novel that retains setting and folklore elements from its predecessor, but features new protagonist and heroines. Unlike the Suigetsu 2 for PlayStation 3, this portable release includes new characters and features additional story elements and CG events. From the main menu, the player can access bonus menu which holds background music and gallery stills and replay mode for each of the heroines, each of which is unlockable as you attain it through the story gameplay.

The story takes place in a small spa town, a hometown of the story protagonist, Moriya Fujimihara (藤見原 守矢). One day during the summer vacation, on his way back from archery practice, Moriya stumbled upon two girls bathing in the lake in the forest. He left the scene in a hurry, but as he returned home later that day he was greeted by none other than the girls he met in the forest. It turns out they are daughters of his father's friend, and are going to stay for a while at Moriya's place.

sample_screenshots.caption: Unexpected meeting with girls from the forest

title: Suigetsu 2 Portable

description:
Kouji Saitou (斉藤 光志) is a private investigator who finds himself arrested for the murder he did not commit. What's more, he was pretty drunk when arrested and doesn't remember much around the time when the murder took place. Taken into detention, he needs to rely on other people to gather clues and prove his innocence. His girlfriend, Noriko Shinjou (新城 法子), while shocked at first, believes in his innocence and decides to help him find out more about the last night's events and keep him apprised.

During dialogues with other characters you will be given clues which in turn you'll be able to use to present in order to prove your innocence during interrogation scenes. Interrogation scenes present a bar which can either deplete if you answer incorrectly or present irrelevant clues which will make you look guilty, or it will fill as you successfully answer the questions that will exonerate you. Words marked in green during dialogues can be selected to give you more background on what is meant by that. When controlling Noriko, you'll be able to talk to other characters like in visual novels, with ability to look around each room and interact with certain objects to gather more information and clues. The story progresses through days and you have a time limit of 23 days to exonerate yourself and find the real culprit.

sample_screenshots.caption: Key words are marked in green and selectable for further elaboration
Discussing why you've been imprisoned with a detective
Your girlfriend keeping you informed of her findings

title: Enkaku Sōsa: Shinjitsu e no 23 Hiai

description:
W Pocket (read as Double Pocket) release of L no Kisetsu series contains both games from the series which were previously only released on PlayStation and PlayStation 2 respectively. This dual release is also the only release of the games for PlayStation Portable platform.

Games included in this release are:

  • L no Kisetsu: A Piece of Memories* L no Kisetsu 2: Invisible Memories
title: L no Kisetsu: W Pocket

description:
This Limited Edition release of Saihate no Ima Portable visual novel includes:

  • Saihate no Ima Portable game
  • Special booklet (32 pages)
  • Soundtrack CD (22 tracks)
title: Saihate no Ima Portable (Genteiban)

description:
WipEout Pure: Stealth Edition is a demo version of WipEout Pure which was bundled together with the UMD release of the 2005 Rob Cohen film Stealth. The demo contains three game modes, three tracks, and three teams.

The game modes included are single race, time trial, and zone. Both single race and time trial can be played both in single player and local multi player while zone is single player only.

The three tracks included are Vineta K, Pro Toso, and Stealth, a track based on the film that the demo is bundled in.

The three teams included are Feisar, Piranha, and Stealth, also based on the film that the demo is bundled with.

Both the track and team that are based on the film Stealth are exclusive to the demo and can't be obtained in the main game in any way.
title: WipEout Pure: Stealth Edition

description:
1/2 Summer+ (read as One Side Summer+) is a non-adult PlayStation Portable release of a PC (Windows) adult visual novel 1/2 Summer. While the story has been adjusted to deal with the lack of adult scenes, this PSP port features additional upgrades to compensate for that.

New features exclusive to this PlayStation Portable port include:

  • Main story includes new heroine, Matsuri Suzuno (紗乃末璃)
  • Additional scenario with sub-heroine, Kazuha Kusanagi (草薙一葉)
  • Significant revision of the original story and heroine scenarios
  • New graphics and CG events
  • New theme song, "Natsuiro Orchestra" (vocal: Nao)
  • New opening video
title: 1/2 Summer+

description:
77: Beyond the Milky Way (read as "Sevens: Beyond the Milky Way") is a non-adult PlayStation Portable port from PC (Windows) adult visual novel game 77: And, Two Stars Meet Again. The story is adjusted to deal with the lack of adult scenes, and a compensation for that also includes lots of new contents such as bonus scenario, new graphics and CG events. Additionally, this release comes with a couple of other extras such as wallpapers for PSP handheld.

Sevens is a fantasy visual novel which takes place in the not-so-distant future on a school campus situated on a floating island in the Tokyo bay area. Every year, the school celebrates a "Star Waiting Festival", and this year, Shou Tsukishiro (月城 翔), the protagonist, has been selected to wear the ring of Altair. The students are divided into three groups... Knowledge, Power, and Fate, and from each group a girl is chosen to compete in contest, and the winning one will be enter a union with the guy wearing the ring. This just means our reluctant ring-wearer is in for a lot of restless and noisy days ahead of him.
title: 77: Beyond the Milky Way

description:
Canvas 4: Eternal Étude for PlayStation Portable is a non-adult port of an adult visual novel for PC (Windows), Canvas 4: Achrome Étude. As a compensation for the lack of adult content and to provide a reason to replay the game for those who played the PC version, this PSP port includes completely redrawn new CG events.

Ryou Komatsubara (小松原 亮) has been awarded an art scholarship as a prize on a Sakura festival which got him admitted into Nadeshiko Academy. During his school days he ends up living together with his childhood friend, Kotono Aogiri (青桐 ことの), who has been like a sister to him. That, in turn, is making Kotono rater irritated as she doesn't feel like Ryou see her for what she is, a woman, especially since Kotono's feelings for Ryou are stirring up inside her.The season of autumn has come, and art festival with Nadeshiko Academy and other schools is approaching. But despite his talent as an artist, Ryou doesn't feel he's up to the task as he is struggling to find the spark of satisfaction and considers his portraits of people, while technically perfect, rather unfinished.
title: Eternal Étude: Canvas 4

description:
D.C.III+ is the third main game in the Da Capo series, and is a port of an updated PC (Windows) release known as Da Capo III Dash: Ver.1.3 which features many updates and additions to the base game.

The game takes place 17 years after the events in the D.C. II: P.S., where Kiyotaka Yoshino (芳乃 清隆), a sophomore in Kazami Academy is enjoying his time at the school's newspaper club, surrounded by beautiful heroines and leisurely spending days. The strange things began to happen when the sakura tree on campus started blooming during the winter and all the school students started receiving a mysterious message regarding the sakura tree. The message was dated 1951. Newspaper club members are set to unravel the secret behind the mysterious events plaguing the school campus.
title: D.C. III+

description:
Kono Aozora ni Yakusoku wo: Tenohira no Rakuen is the first port of the game to a handheld platform. Just like a PlayStation 2 port, this PlayStation Portable release is also a non-adult version of the original game which came out for PC (Windows).

All the new elements included in the PS2 port are present in this PSP version as well, with some further additions which include:

  • new heroine, Chihiro Kudou (久藤 ちひろ) included in the main scenario story
  • four new side stories added
title: Kono Aozora ni Yakusoku wo: Tenohira no Rakuen

description:
The PSP Power Pack is a compilation of three games previously only released as downloadable games on PSN. It contains:

  • Beats
  • flOw
  • Syphon Filter: Combat Ops
title: PlayStation Network Collection: Power Pack

description:
This PSP Puzzle Collection is a compilation of three puzzle games previously released as downloadable games on PSN. It contains:

  • Go! Puzzle
  • Go! Sudoku
  • Lemmings
title: PlayStation Network Collection: Puzzle Pack

description:
In Criminal Girls, the player takes the role of a prison warden in Hell who has been assigned to a group of seven girls. Although these seven have all been damned to Hell for their sins in life, they qualify for an early release program in which they must climb a tower to earn a second chance in the realm of the living. However, they are defiant and rebellious, not wanting to do what they're told. The player must therefore whip the girls into shape, sometimes literally, in order to help them complete their rehabilitation. On their way up the tower, the girls must fight other prisoners in RPG-style battles.

One of the main gameplay mechanics is Motivation, through which the girls learn new skills, gain the will to fight, and come to terms with their sins. It plays out as a minigame in which the player uses items such as whips and shock devices to destroy "temptations" that appear on the screen, after which they can cuddle with the girl. The minigame is accompanied by images of the chosen girl in suggestive poses.
title: Criminal Girls

description:
FIFA Soccer 06 is the second appearance of the series on the PSP, only half a year after the previous game. It includes most of that game's modes (a cut-down selection of those from the console versions), while updating teams and rosters, revising the controls and adding several new features, including an exclusive mini-game.

The game includes teams from 25 leagues from 18 countries, along with assorted teams from the rest of the world and 40 international teams. Game modes include a play now option for friendlies and season and tournament play (each customizable). Challenges, a long-time staple of handheld entries in the series, also return, with 20 comeback and 20 rout challenges from the 2004-2005 season, the completion of which unlocks a custom challenge editor. Infrastructure multiplayer has been added in addition to the returning ad hoc mode.

The exclusive mini-game is called juggling. Choosing from one of the included licensed players, the goal is to keep the ball in the air by bouncing it on legs and head. The game is played by holding the PSP sideways so the player is in full view. An icon indicates which of the directional buttons must be pressed while the ball is in the center of the icon. The game is played for high score, with higher playing levels increasing the difficulty.

Controls during regular gameplay have been refined. In particular, the First Touch and Freestyle controls are no longer mapped to the directional pad but instead to the analog stick with the shoulder button as modifier.
title: FIFA Soccer 06

description:
FIFA Soccer 07 is the third appearance of the soccer series on the PSP. It builds upon the previous year's version with updated rosters, new control options and new game modes.

The game includes 27 leagues from 20 countries (adding the Turkish league), plus various rest-of-the-world and international teams, the same selection as in the console version. Returning modes include Kick-Off for friendlies, tournaments and challenges (with 31 new comeback and 30 new rout challenges) and wi-fi multiplayer (ad-hoc and infrastructure). The manager mode, already an established feature in the console versions, makes its debut on the PSP in this game. It tasks players with managing a club team, taking care of sponsors, the club board, and fan relations in addition to success on the pitch. PSP manager careers are compatible with those from the PS2 version and can be exchanged via PS2-PSP link. Exclusive to the PSP version is player training via mini-games (which are also available on their own): the returning Juggling and the new Wall Attack. In Wall Attack, the goal is to kick the ball at a wall of colored blocks for points, with a certain number necessary within a time limit to advance to the next level. Some blocks contain icons that have additional effects, like clearing neighboring blocks or blocks of the same color.

Among the new control options are chip shots and various new configurations: there is a choice between player control via analog stick or d-pad (or both, but without on-the-fly tactics changes) and optional PES-style button layout.
title: FIFA Soccer 07

description:
Originated on PC (Windows) as an adult visual novel titled Kimi ga Aruji de Shitsuji ga Ore de, it has undergone many changes (removal of adult content and addition of various new and remade contents) when being ported to PlayStation 2 console under title Kimi ga Aruji de Shitsuji ga Ore de: Otsukae Nikki.

This PlayStation Portable release which came out several years after the PS2 port features further changes which include:

  • newly recorded opening movie
  • redesigned gameplay system offering better visibility and controls
  • certain banned CG events from Windows version onto PS2 port are included in PSP release
  • new CG events unique to PSP release in addition to all the new events that were included in PS2 port
title: Kimi ga Aruji de Shitsuji ga Ore de: Otsukae Nikki Portable

description:
FIFA Soccer 08 is another yearly update in the soccer franchise and is the the fourth entry to appear on the PSP. It enhances the previous year's edition with new leagues and teams, updated rosters, and new gameplay modes, while retaining all of the established features.

The team lineup is the same as on other platforms, adding Australian, Czech and Irish leagues for a total of 30 national leagues, along with 20 clubs from the rest of the world and 43 international teams. Returning game modes include friendlies, manager mode, tournaments, wi-fi multiplayer, challenges (updated for the new season) and the mini-games Juggling and Wall Attack. Manager mode now features friendly matches in the off-season.

Introduced in the previous year's console version, the Interactive Leagues mode makes its debut on the PSP in this game. It allows players to play matches of their favorite club against other players according to the real-life schedule. Another new feature is the ability to create custom formations.

An entirely new mode is called Football IQ, which is a trivia quiz. It features trivia questions with a diagram of a field next to them. Answering questions correctly moves the ball forward on the field, eventually putting it in the goal, while getting them wrong moves it backwards and lets the other team score. The quiz features several levels, starting with questions about local clubs, then later moving into other leagues.
title: FIFA Soccer 08

description: Deardrops Distortion is a PSP port of an adult PC visual novel game called Deardrops. All the sex scenes have been removed in the port and rating reduced, with story adjusted to work without those scenes. In addition, the PSP port got new CG event scenes and graphics as well as new costumes for the live performance of character in the main story.
title: Deardrops Distortion

description:
FairlyLife: MiracleDays is a PSP port from a PC adult visual novel FairlyLife. In this port all the sex scenes have been removed and story has been adjusted to work without those CG events.

As a compensation for removal of the adult content, PSP release features these new additions:

  • new scenario and new graphics
  • included Miku character from the fandisk "Mikurimakuri" scenario
  • various PSP accessories such as character watches and wallpapers

sample_screenshots.caption: Asagao sure is an eccentric little girl
BGM player lets you scroll to see full character
Loading screens contains various random images of game heroines

title: Fairly Life: Miracle Days

description:
NBA 10: The Inside is a basketball simulation game exclusive to the PSP and the follow-up to NBA 09: The Inside as an entry to Sony's NBA franchise. Along with the standard career and franchise modes that emphasize realism, the game includes a variety of mini-games such as hot shot, whack-a-mole and skee ball.

The game also includes the Conquest mode that first appeared in NBA 09: The Inside, as a Risk-like board game, based on the mechanics of mini-games such as Dodgeball, Elimination and Give & Go. By winning games an 'army' of basketball players challenges NBA teams all over the country by visiting their cities and players can also be lost to other teams.
title: NBA 10: The Inside

description: Originally released for Dreamcast in 2002/2003 in three separate game releases, each featuring two episodes, it was ported to PlayStation 2 in 2003/2004 and released in two separate game releases, each featuring three episodes. This PlayStation Portable release contains all six original episodes including a bonus new scenario not featured in any of the previous releases. This compilation release is the only release of the game series for PSP platform.
title: Missing Parts: The Tantei Stories - Complete

description:
This limited edition release includes:

  • Gift: Prism
  • Special booklet
  • Soundtrack
title: Gift: Prism (Genteiban)

description:
The classic puzzle series comes to the PSP as a launch window title with Puzzle Bobble Pocket.

Gameplay follows the standard formula: the player controls a catapult at the bottom of the play field that shoots bubbles of random colors. When three or more bubbles of the same color touch, they are removed from the field. After a while, the existing bubbles are pushed down into the play field by a descending ceiling or by more bubbles being added from the top. The game is lost when the bubbles reach the bottom. Special bubbles include explosive ones that destroy bubbles they touch, bowling balls that knock off all bubbles in their path, star bubbles that remove all bubbles of the same color as the bubble they are touched by, and rainbow bubbles that change color into the color of a bubble group that gets popped adjacent to them.

There are four modes to choose from: Single, Endless, VS and Survival. Single is the classic single-player puzzle game, featuring 500 levels. The goal in each is to clear the pre-set pattern of bubbles. Endless is the unwinnable variant in which more bubbles are always pushed in from the top, played for high score. VS is the competitive variant played against a number of CPU opponents, where popping more than the required three bubbles sends them over to the opponent's field. Survival is a variant of the VS game: after winning a round, the own play field is not reset.
title: Puzzle Bobble Pocket

description:
Namco Museum for the PSP is another in Namco's line of classic arcade compilations.

It includes the following games:

  • Pac-Man
  • Ms. Pac-Man (Japanese version only)
  • Galaxian
  • Galaga
  • Rally-X
  • New Rally-X
  • Dig Dug

In addition, four games feature "Arrangement" versions with updated graphics and sound, new gameplay features and wireless multi-player: Pac-Man, Galaga, New-Rally X and Dig Dug.

A game share feature lets players send the first levels of the original arcade games to another PSP without the other player needing to own the game.
title: Namco Museum

description:
Namco Museum Vol. 2 is another in Namco's line of classic game collections. It largely consists of the ten games added in the international Battle Collection over the Japanese release of Namco Museum, but also adds some more games. Included are the following classic games:

  • King & Balloon
  • Bosconian
  • Xevious
  • Mappy
  • The Tower of Druaga
  • Grobda
  • Dragon Buster
  • Dig Dug II
  • Motos
  • Rolling Thunder
  • Dragon Spirit (new to this release)

In addition, there are two "Arrangement" versions with updated graphics and sound and gameplay: Motos and a new version of Pac-Man ("Arrangement Plus").
title: Namco Museum Vol. 2

description:
Gretzky NHL 06 for PSP is a hockey game endorsed by legendary player Wayne Gretzky. Released only six months after the previous PSP game, this version comes with updated rosters and several features taken from the PS2 version, but has its own selection of modes.

Returning modes include single games and a full season. The new chemistry feature makes its way over from the PS2, influencing players' stats depending on how well they interact with each other. Also seen on the PS2 is the "Wayne vs Wayne" mode, in which the two competing teams build up their "99 meter". When full, The Great One himself joins the team as an extra player for a short time. In addition to single games, this mode can also be played in the PSP-exclusive NHL Showdown mode, which is a ladder against all NHL teams, with the finale against a team of five Gretzkys. Another exclusive mode is called "3 on 3 Countdown". It is an arcade mode, with only three players per team on the field, without any of the regular rules, and the winner being the team that reaches a set score first.

Online multiplayer, both ad hoc and via infrastructure, also return, as do the Gretzky Challenges: by earning points through in-game achievements, players can unlock bonuses like alternate and vintage uniforms and new gameplay features and modes. Unlike the previous PSP game, Gretzky 06 features color and play-by-play commentary by Mike Emrick and Darren Pang.
title: Gretzky NHL 06

description:
Ratatouille is a 3D platform game based on the Pixar animated film of the same name. Unlike versions for other platforms, the PSP game does not follow the plot of the film but instead presents its own story set after the film's climax, with the voice actors from the film reprising their roles for the game.

Shortly before Linguini and Collete can open their new bistro, their recipes are stolen by their disgruntled ex-employer Skinner. It falls to gourmet rat Remy to bring back the recipes so the new restaurant can open in time.

Remy must move through five worlds of six to seven levels each, accessible from the rat colony hub world. The worlds include Linguini's apartment, the sewers, the marketplace, Paris rooftops and the restaurant. In most levels, Remy's goal is to pick up the recipe that lies somewhere in a hard-to-reach place, but other levels consist only of races or boss fights and the recipe is awarded upon winning. To get around, Remy can jump and double-jump, pull himself up ledges, crouch and run on all fours to get into tight spaces, climb up vertical and swing along horizontal poles and also swim and dive. Some enemy critters like spiders, caterpillars and bats want to hinder Remy on his quest, but he can punch them or hit them with his tail to defeat them. Some small puzzles must be solved to overcome some obstacles, usually involving finding a certain object to be used at the correct place. The ghost of chef Gusteau usually offers hints on what to do next, and Remy's fellow rats also sometimes offer helpful advice.

Lying about the levels are various collectibles. Apples and cupcakes restore lost health. Pieces of cheese function as currency and can be traded in with the merchant rat in the rat colony for upgrades: increasing Remy's health bar, adding more combat moves, increasing his swimming speed and more. Hidden in most levels are star keys. These can be used to unlock chests in the rat colony that contain additional recipes not found in the regular levels. Found recipes can be looked at in the game menu and contain actual cooking instructions for various dishes.

The game also includes two multiplayer modes: a race and a cheese collecting game. The race optionally allows placing chili peppers on the track, the eating of which increases speed. The cheese collecting game has several variants. In the regular variant, the player who collects the most cheese within the time limit wins. The 'weighted' variant makes a player slow down upon collecting cheese. Putting the collected cheese into a designated drop area restores regular speed. In the 'chef hat' variant, hats materialize when five pieces of cheese have been collected, with the winner being the player who collects the required number of hats or the most hats after the time limit ends.
title: Disney•Pixar Ratatouille

description: Gallery Fake is a mystery adventure based on the manga from 1992 with the same name. The title also spanned anime TV series in 2005 which aired 9 months prior to this game's release. The story follows Reiji Fujita (藤田 玲司), who is an art dealer and an expert in spotting a fake art. The game mostly plays as a visual novel with occasional choices where the player needs to prove that some art piece is a fake in a so called "Break a Fake" game mode.

sample_screenshots.caption: Sara is reminiscing how she came to work with Fujita
Guess he dozed off in a suit
Presenting gathered clue to contradict something
The right clue was presented at the right time

title: Gallery Fake

description:
Phantasy Star Portable 2 Infinity is an update to Phantasy Star Portable 2. As an update of the previous game it retains most of the features from before, but also adds some additional things,

The story mode consists of two episodes. The first episode is the same as the one found in the previous game, while the second episode is new. This second episode takes place after the "Subspace Incident" of the previous episode and deals with the swordswoman Nagisa and a new race of SEED infected humans called the Duman.

The game features some new options like being able to invite characters the player has created and leveled up to join them as support in battle. There is also the additions of new animations, new weapons and clothing, the type level cap has been increased to 50, a Rebirth system (resets a character back to level 1 but points are given to increase a characters stats), new mission types (Infinity Missions, Training Missions), and Open Missions now have an additional Infinity ranked mission difficulty.
title: Phantasy Star Portable 2 Infinity

description:
This compilation contains the following two PSP games previously published separately:

  • Lemmings
  • LocoRoco
title: Lemmings / LocoRoco

description:
This compilation for PSP is a retail release of five games previously released in the PlayStation Store:

  • Arctic Adventures: Polar's Puzzles
  • Coconut Dodge
  • Red Bull X-Fighters
  • Young Thor
  • Monsters (Probably) Stole My Princess
title: Mega Minis: Volume 2

description:
Mirai Nikki is a survival adventure game based on the manga with the same name. The protagonist of the story is a junior high-school student, Yukiteru Amano (天野 雪輝). One morning, he located his future diary following a strange directions that appeared on his mobile phone. Upon reading a diary for a while, he stumbled on a paragraph describing his own death. Unknowingly, he ended up being pulled in a deadly game of survival by the future diary which has been changing owners, making Yukiteru the 13th owner.

The game features original story in the series, written and supervised by the original manga author, Esuno Sakae. During the game which mostly plays like a visual novel, various choices will lead to different ending, most of them bad, which requires replaying and a bit of luck to get the wanted outcome. The game also features character switching system which lets you select different character after each new entry in the diary which changes the course of the story.

Original game came before the anime adaptation of the series and features no voice-acting, but the Re:write game version came out two years after, featuring several new features as well as full voice-acting by the same actors from the animated TV series.
title: Mirai Nikki: 13-ninme no Nikki Shoyūsha

description:
PES 2012 is a soccer game, primarily a refinement of the previous 2011 version - although it comes with the same gameplay and game modes as the last installment.

The game is exclusively licensed by UEFA and CONMEBOL, to include the UEFA Champions League in Europe, and Copa Santander Libertadores in South America. It also includes official league licenses from Spain, Italy, France and Holland. It's notable for the absence of the English and German leagues, except for Manchester United and Bayern Munich. There are also 33 independent teams, including CSKA Moscow, Boca Juniors, River Plate or Oporto. Player can choose between 60 national teams to play friendly matches or custom tournaments.

PES 2012 offers a fast arcade gameplay in several game modes, such as Master League, Become a Legend or classic tournaments. Gameplay is more fluid, and goalkeepers have been improved in their performances. Defense lines have also been improved, with AI players making more intelligent movements and behaving in a more realistic way.
title: PES 2012: Pro Evolution Soccer

description:
Tenebrae is a horror adventure set in a fictional futuristic place called New Island City where a huge incident occurred involving multiple people, some of whose stories the player can experience by playing through each of their perspectives. This game is a first out of planned but cancelled four episodes, and though each episode work as a standalone story, they all share the common core which helps bind the overall story.

In this first episode, the story follows a reportage writer, Seiji Inugami (犬上 征爾) who one evening receives a phone call prompting him that something big is going to happen in New Island City. While reluctant to take a commission to collect the data onsite at first, he ends up coerced into agreement by the caller who blackmails him with something from Seiji's past which he was part of 15 years ago where he witnessed something he shouldn't have. On his way to the city, he ends up meeting his old friend, police detective Kaoru Saegusa who is working on a case involving a series of disappearances. While friendly chatting, they hear what sounds like a sea of screams in the distance. As they look toward it, they see a huge black fog enveloping the area. Thus, the search for answers and uncovering the mystery behind it begins.
title: Yami kara no Izanai: Tenebrae I

description: In Need for Speed: Undercover you play an undercover agent, tasked with arresting stolen car dealers in the illegal street racer community. Different from other versions, you will unlock and select pre-defined races on a map. Different modes like sprint, time trial or knockout races let you compete against up to 5 opponents. If you ram police cars often enough, they will break down completely.
title: Need for Speed: Undercover
Neopets: Petpet Adventures - The Wand of Wishing
SOCOM: U.S. Navy SEALs - Fireteam Bravo 3
