description:
Unlike the original game, AKB1/48: Idol to Koishitara..., released a year earlier, this game is sort of a dream where each of the AKB48 idols are in love with you, but you're only be able to select and profess your love to one of them in the end. AKB48 (AKB is abbreviation of Akihabara, an electronic town in Tokyo) is a j-pop idol group with, yes, you guessed it, 48 members in total. Members aren't constant and their popularity is based on votes by the fans of the group. As the title implies, the game takes place in the island of Guam, and idols will wear bikinis a lot, and regular clothes lot less.

The game mostly plays like a visual novel which user real-life locations and actual idols in various poses over the background image instead of anime art. The setting itself is not the only thing differing from the first game. This game features new poses and photo shots with different clothes (the more showing kind) and re-recorded voice-acting by AKB48 members for the new scenario. The game progresses one day at the time where you spend with one of the idols, either on a date or in casual talk. The player is given a list of letters sent to you by AKB48 girls with their profiles. Based on who sent you the message, you can reply to it which eventually leads you to a date with that person. You can use the phone to call the person of interest and set a date. During the date part which plays as a visual novel, there will be a dialogue selection which will show the girl you're with if you're rude, indifferent or like her. This in turn may prompt her to contact you again at the beginning of the next day. Some correspondence occurs irregularly when the girl liked how she felt when she was with you on previous dates. Likewise, addresses of the girls you were rude with will disappear from the list until only one remains. Initially, all 48 girls are listed as your potential girlfriends. During special so called escort event scenes, idols will wear a special bikini and pose jut for you. Any event scene during visual novel gameplay lets on-screen text be toggled off and allows for certain amount of zooming.

Various unlockables such as visual cards, event scenes, and steel photos can accessed from the menu, while collected cards can be traded with other players. AKB48 soundtrack does not need to be unlocked and can be listened via BGM player. It additionally lets the player select default BGM song and theme song for each of the ABK48 members.

Initial first print retail release comes with a photo (random one out of 48) of one of the AKB48 members.

sample_screenshots.caption: Being rude will result in idol's address deleted from your address book
She was very happy with how the day unfolded and would like to meet again

title: AKB1/48: Idol to Guam de Koishitara...

description:
Blood: The Last Vampire is part of the Yarudora (やるドラ) game series which are meant to be played as an interactive anime. As is the case with earlier games in the series, Blood: The Last Vampire features full voice-acting and plays non-stop as a regular TV anime with player choices which need to be selected in a time limit of only a couple of seconds and result in story branching or slight alteration of the events. The game has multiple endings and by re-playing it, more choices and ending get unlocked. There is a flowchart show the overall story progress and taken routes so replaying does not become repetitive.

The PSP release of Blood: The Last Vampire is a compilation of first (上巻) and last volume (下巻) which were released as two separate games for PlayStation 2. In addition the PSP release has doubled the CG gallery and also includes special movie edits for each of the three heroines which can be unlocked by completing the game.

Based on the manga and anime movie with the same title, this game focuses on the story set in Tokyo a couple of decades after the original series. While the anime and game stories don't have direct connection, the game setting is based on the same world as in the original series. While Saya is the protagonist of the original story, this story features a young boy who is a high-school student, as the protagonist. One day, while riding a subway, he experiences the strangest sensation... he starts hearing a demonic voice that no one else can hear. This soon starts to affect his daily life and drive him towards madness, but then Saya, the last remaining original vampire enters his life.

sample_screenshots.caption: There is a countdown to player's response, if nothing is selected the default answer will be auto-selected

title: Blood: The Last Vampire

description: Yu-Gi-Oh! GX: Tag Force 3 is the third game based on the anime Yu-Gi-Oh! GX. In the game, you are a new student, arriving in the Duel Academy who encounter your new friends Jaden, Jessie or Alexis Rhodes. By talking to others students and peoples you can do duels, you can make new companions for double duels and make friends by offering them some gifts. You can use more than 3,000 cards to build a powerful deck ever and develop strategies to beat all your opponents.
title: Yu-Gi-Oh! GX: Tag Force 3

description: Yu-Gi-Oh! 5D's Tag Force 4 is the fourth installment in the Yu-Gi-Oh! Tag Force series. In the game you play turn-based duels with cards against people including Yusei, Jack or Rex. You have to increase their loyalty by doing co-op duels with them. When their loyalty is at the maximum you can make a special and big duel against famous and more powerful people. After beating your opponent you get new cards.
title: Yu-Gi-Oh!: 5D's Tag Force 4

description:
This first print limited edition release includes:

  • Koi to Senkyo to Chocolate Portable
  • Additional UMD with mini-games and other bonus content
  • Wallscroll featuring the main heroine
title: Koi to Senkyo to Chocolate Portable (Shokai Genteiban)

description: EyePet is a pet simulation game with minigames and customization. Modeled after the original PS3 game it changes a few things for the portable format. The game requires a PSP camera and a "magic card" (included within the game package) to play. By pointing the PSP with the camera attached on the magic card the player makes the cute creature appear on screen. The player can play a variety of games with the pet, such as bowling, fishing or jumping on trampolines. The game encourages playing in different environments; by doing so the player has a chance of finding "treasures" - customization items. In a separate in-game area called Pet home the player may take care of the pet - feed it, wash it etc. and also change its appearance to their liking.
title: EyePet

description: EyePet Adventures is the second game in the EyePet series for the PSP. The basic concept is the same: by pointing the PSP with the PSP camera attached on the 'magic card' the player can interact with a cute pet - play mini-games, feed and wash it, customize its appearance. The added features include the new Explorer Club mode - the player controls a submarine-like transport (called EyePet Explorer Craft) with the pet inside exploring the 2D-scrolling environments for treasure and customization items. The creature's new home and customization area is located inside this EyePet Explorer Craft.

sample_screenshots.caption: An overview of what you need to play the game: device, camera and magic card

title: EyePet Adventures

description: Buzz!: Brain Bender contains 16 brain-bending mini-games across four categories: Analysis, Observation, Memory and Calculation. By taking the tests medals can be earned in each game. Boffin Awards can be collected and progress can be compared with friends.

sample_screenshots.caption: You need to complete the test before you can access the rest of the game.
Repeat the pattern Simon Says style.

title: Buzz! Brain Bender

description:
Salamander Portable is a compilation that contains ports of five arcade shooters from Konami:* Life Force (updated Japanese version)

  • Gradius 2 (MSX version)
  • Salamander
  • Salamander 2
  • Xexex

The MSX version of Gradius 2 (aka Nemesis 2) is included in two variants, an Enhanced version (default) with smooth scroll and updated graphics, or the original version. In addition the games settings menu has an option to select if a second Konami cartridge is present. Just like with the original game this has certain effects, such as cheats or changed visuals.
title: Salamander Portable

description: White Knight Chronicles: Origins is an action RPG. War has broken out in the kingdom of Athwan. The incorrupti, terrible knights from ancient times attack and the legendary powers of the optimist crystal can be Athwans last hope. Fight wild beasts and armies from the past. Play together with up to three other players online and swap your favorite quests and avatars.

sample_screenshots.caption: That takes care of those two.
These birds can help you communicate with other players.

title: White Knight Chronicles: Origins

description:
Re:write game version came out two years after the original release under Mirai Nikki: 13-ninme no Nikki Shoyūsha title, and after the TV anime series with the same title.

The main changes in this Re:write release of the game include:

  • Full voice-acting by the same actors from anime TV series
  • Additional scenario
  • New character
title: Mirai Nikki: 13-ninme no Nikki Shoyūsha - Re:write

description:
Originally released for PC (Windows) as an adult visual novel just called Snow in 2003, the game was ported to PlayStation 2 platform a year later where the adult content was removed, and voice-acting and new CG event graphics and story expansion was added. Almost four years later, the PLayStation Portable port came out with even more new content and updates.

Aside from the lack of adult content, most notable difference between this PSP and original PC version include:

  • New heroines; the original version had four while PSP version features six heroines in total
  • New CG events; original new artwork and story branch integrated in the main story
  • Completely new version of voice-acting for popular in-game characters
title: Snow Portable

description:
Oni-gokko! originated as a PC (Windows) fantasy adult visual novel two years prior to this PSP release. During the port story was adjusted to work without all the adult scenes which were also removed, but the removal of adult CG content was compensated by adding a lot of new content not previously available in the PC release.

New PSP release content includes:

  • Nazuna, a new heroine
  • Scenario upgrade and adjustment, plus new scenario for new heroine
  • Many new CG event scenes, including those related to new heroine
  • New opening song (original opening song is also available as arranged version)
  • New opening video
title: Onigokko! Portable

description:
Shining Hearts is the first game in the Shining universe for PSP platform. The game takes place on a peaceful island of Wyndaria. But things on the island turn more hectic after a great storm one day. A mysterious girl called Kaguya washed ashore, lost her memories, and even her feelings. Rick, a young swordsman who works at the local bakery, finds the lost girl and decides to help her regain her memories. To make things worse, once peaceful island of Wyndaria becomes the target for pirates as they swarm on it searching for a spirit stone who just happens to be in the necklace Kaguya is wearing.

Shining Hearts is a 3D party based role-playing game played from a bird's view perspective. The player can explore various islands in the game, starting with the island of Wyndaria, or use the ship to travel the seas and visit other islands. Player's ship can be upgraded and added various functionality to over time. The battle screen is split into a grid formation with front and back row, and the battle itself is turn-based. The player can select physical attack with weapons, use magic, or choose the guard move to boost the defense. The game features typical RPG elements such as trading weapons and items with merchants, performing various mini-game activities, upgrading your characters, solving side quests, and shaping the world in the game based on player's actions. By performing side quests, player will earn special hearts which will help Kaguya regain her emotions and in turn open gates to new places to progress the main story. Based on player's actions, the hearts that will be collected may change in color and affect the world in that manner. Each color depicting an awarded emotion, such as happiness, kindness, anger, sadness or hatred.
title: Shining Hearts

description:
AKB1/48: Idol to Koishitara... is a romance adventure game featuring all the girls from AKB48 pop idol group. The story begins in a dreamlike situation where all the girls are in love with you, but in the end, you will have to choose only one. AKB48 (AKB is abbreviation of Akihabara, an electronic town in Tokyo) is a j-pop idol group with 48 members in total. Members aren't constant and their popularity is based on votes by the fans of the group. This is the first game in the series and takes place in Tokyo (background images during visual-novel style gameplay are photos from various known locations in Tokyo).

The game mostly plays like a visual novel which features real-life locations and actual idols in various poses over the background image instead of anime art. The game progresses one day at the time where you spend with one of the idols, either on a date or in casual talk. The player is given a list of letters sent to you by AKB48 girls with their profiles. Based on who sent you the message, you can reply to it which eventually leads you to a date with that person. You can use the phone to call the person of interest and set a date. During the date part which plays as a visual novel, there will be a dialogue selection which will show the girl you're with if you're rude, indifferent or like her. This in turn may prompt her to contact you again at the beginning of the next day. Some correspondence occurs irregularly when the girl liked how she felt when she was with you on previous dates. Likewise, addresses of the girls you were rude with will disappear from the list until only one remains. Initially, all 48 girls are listed as your potential girlfriends. During special so called escort event scenes, idols will wear a special outfit just for you. Any event scene during visual novel gameplay lets on-screen text be toggled off and allows for certain amount of zooming.

Various unlockables such as visual cards, event scenes, and steel photos can accessed from the menu, while collected cards can be traded with other players. AKB48 soundtrack does not need to be unlocked and can be listened via BGM player. It additionally lets the player select default BGM song and theme song for each of the ABK48 members. Voice-acting for each of the AKB48 girls in the game is done by AKB48 members.
title: AKB1/48: Idol to Koishitara...

description:
Ouka Sengoku! Portable is a handheld port of an adult visual novel for PC (Windows) and DVD Player titled Ouka Sengoku!: Nobunaga-chan no Koishite Yabou!?. This PSP port has all the adult content removed as expected, but contains various extras to compensate for the loss of it. Retail version was released for PSP in regular and special edition format, and for a short-while, the title was also available in digital format on PSN for PSP and PSVita platforms.

Newly added content not present in the original PC release includes:

  • Newly drawn package art for PSP release
  • 2 new heroines and 1 new sub-heroine added to the story
  • Added full voice-acting for new characters
  • Revision was done on the original scenario with additional new routes for existing heroines
  • Bonus scenario included after clearing the main story
  • Added over 40 new CG event scenes with new artwork
  • New opening movie
  • New opening song and new ending song
title: Ōka Sengoku! Portable

description: Akehime no Shou (朱姫の章) is the last chapter in the four-volume Phase D sci-fi visual novel series. There are four phases of human existence. From conception to birth is called Phase A. From birth to death is called Phase B. From death to disappearance of the corpse is Phase C. And last, remnant after the death, separate from the corpse, is referred to as Phase D. As with the previous chapters, the general story is very similar but revolves around a new protagonist, Ren Ichishi, and features new characters and places.
title: Phase D: Akehime no Shō

description:
Your Memory's Off: Girl's Style is a PlayStation Portable port of the PlayStation 2 game with the same title released a year earlier. Unlike most Memories Off games, this is an otome game with female protagonist.

While there is no missing content from PS2 release, the PSP port features several new elements, such as:

  • New After Story scenario added for each character after clearing the main story
  • New scenario added to the main story written by the same writer for the original PS2 game
  • New CG event scenes added by the same artist of the original PS2 game
title: Your Memories Off: Girl's Style

sample_screenshots.caption: There are three different control options.
The shield doesn't hold very long when engulfed in lava.

description: TRICK×LOGIC is a mystery solving game comprised of five separate cases main protagonist solves by analyzing statements and gaining keywords that will help him uncover the real crime and motive using deduction and reasoning. Most of the game shows a vertically displayed text with dialogues that work as a typical visual-novel style showing 2D anime-style character sprites over static backgrounds with dialogue text in bubbly window at the bottom. Each of the cases is written by different mystery writer.
title: Trick × Logic: Season 1

description:
This limited edition retail release includes:

  • Renai 0 Kilometer Portable game
  • Vocal collection CD (contains all songs from both PC and PSP game versions)
title: Renai 0 Kilometer Portable (Genteiban)

description:
This limited edition boxed retail release includes:

  • R-15 Portable game
  • Microfiber towel with heroines (1.5m x 0.5m)
  • Temperature-sensitive bath poster (clothes come off the heroine)
  • CD-ROM containing various bonus digital contents
title: R-15 Portable (DX Pack)

description:
This limited edition boxed retail release includes:

  • Tasogare no Sinsemilla Portable game
  • Tasorage no Sinsemilla sound collection (audio CD)
  • Game production materials booklet (A5 size, 32 pages)

Sound collection CD contains these 11 audio tracks:

  • 01:56 | "Natsu no Fantasia" (short version)
  • 03:46 | "Haori" (羽織り)
  • 01:52 | "Natsu Hotaru" (夏蛍)
  • 01:50 | "Sakuya" (沙久耶)
  • 01:51 | "Shoujo no Maibane" (少女の舞い羽根)
  • 01:47 | "Hinata no Oka" (日向の丘)
  • 01:40 | "Shirogane no Kagami" (銀の鑑)
  • 01:40 | "Meidou" (鳴動)
  • 02:37 | "Kizu" (傷)
  • 01:32 | "Karei Honpou" (華麗奔放)
  • 03:04 | "Natsu no Kiseki" (夏の軌跡)

Booklet with production materials contains:

  • Prologue (page 1, color)
  • Character info (page 2-8, color)
  • Character relationship chart (page 9, black & white)
  • Gameplay guide (page 10-11, black & white)
  • Concept art sketches (page 12-17, black & white)
  • Staff interviews (page 18-24, black & white)
  • History (page 25, color)
  • Character art & costumes (page 26-31, color)
  • Epilogue (page 32, color)
title: Tasogare no Sinsemilla Portable (Genteiban)

description: Toradora Portable! is a romantic comedy adventure game based on Toradora comics and animates series. The player controls Ryuuji Takasu, original protagonists of the series, in a whole new story. Similar to other visual novel adventure games, the story progresses by moving around the map of town and school and talking to other characters. The game features story branching, unlockable routes and multiple endings. Bonuses which can be accessed via main menu include CG gallery, music player, and 3 mini-games.
title: Toradora P!

description: Second Novel is a visual novel adventure game revolving around a tragic past and trying to remember what exactly has happened by reliving it. Naoya, the protagonist, Ayano, and Yuichi have been close friends during their high school days. But one day, Yuichi fell to his death from the roof of a high school building. Five years have passed since that day, and Naoya has moved and is regular salary man. During summer holidays, he returns to his hometown and reunites with Ayano who has a memory problem in a way that she can only remember 15 minutes of the time the two of them met. Together, they reminisce and try to recall their high school days which in turn may also shed some light into Yuichi's untimely death. Beside the story mode, the game also has so-called fragment mode which slowly gets unlocked with new memory fragments as the player unfolds the main story scenario. The library, accessible via main menu, contains various bonuses and unlockables, namely memory scenes, CG gallery, and a music player.
title: Second Novel: Kanojo no Natsu, 15 Fun no Kioku

description:
Kaitou Tenshi is a visual novel fantasy game with battles that are done using active slot system. Haruka (Red Angel) and Aoi (Blue Angel) are just a couple of regular students who at first sight seem like any other girls at their school campus. But in secret, they are "Kaitou Tenshi Twin Angel" heroines of justice, fighting Black Trader, the leader of a dark organization. In their last exploits, they managed to destroy the deadly satellite weapon and defeat Black Trader. Upon returning back to peaceful school life again, they were shocked to find out that someone stole a treasure relic known as "Angel's Tear". Deciding to find the culprit and recover the stolen treasure will lead them through a maze or intrigues and conspiracies.

During dialogues gameplay resembles that of a typical visual novel, while the battles play as slot system where characters are fully visible on the screen with slot machine using one of the pre-set buttons to stop it and score three of the same images to deliver powerful blow. The game also features various unlockables such as music tracks, CG event scenes, or movies, which are accessible from main menu.
title: Kaitō Tenshi: Twin Angel - Toki to Sekai no Labyrinth

description:
A compilation of:

  • Archer Maclean's Mercury
  • Mercury Meltdown
title: 2 Games in 1! Archer Maclean's Mercury / Mercury Meltdown

description:
Blue Label is a male version of the original Mother Goose no Himitsu no Yakata: Nursery Rhymes for You game that came out half a year earlier for the same platform. While the original game featured a female protagonist with male NPCs and was focused at a female audience, being an otome game and all, this game doesn't really alter the story but adds new a male protagonist and adds many female heroines to interact with.

The game has several bonuses accessible via the main menu, such as a quiz, BGM player, gallery and search engine for keywords that relate to the game providing detailed information. Gameplay-wise, this is a typical romantic visual novel, but unlike the majority of Japanese-only visual novels, the game has full English support for subtitles and on-screen text. To speed up the UMD reading process, the game also has an install option.
title: Mother Goose no Himitsu no Yakata: Blue Label

description: Star Driver is a sci-fi visual novel with battle elements based on the anime with the same name. The setting takes place in a Southern Cross high school on a fictional Southern Cross island, same as in the anime, where the protagonist, named by the player, ends up entangled in controlling Cybodies and fighting opposition in Zero Time dimension. The game story branches based on player's choices, and the story itself is not written as new scenario or same scenario as the anime, but instead, an "if" scenario which lets the player alter the original story as if the game's new protagonist was there in the original anime. During even scenes the game sometimes switches to so-called kinship mode where you can get more intimate with the heroines of your choice. While in that mode, the gameplay screen turns to portrait mode, unlike the rest of the game which is using landscape mode.
title: Star Driver: Kagayaki no Takt - Ginga Bishōnen Densetsu

Dissidia 012 [duodecim] Final Fantasy: Sephiroth - Kingdom Hearts Gear

Dissidia 012 [duodecim] Final Fantasy: Final Fantasy XIII Music
Dragon Ball Z: Tenkaichi Tag Team

description:
A mother tells her son a tale of their ancestors battling monsters known as the Teras Pharma almost a century ago and that the monsters are due to return every hundred years. This tale inspired the young boy to grow up as a swordsman so he'd be prepared to fight these monsters when the time came. On top of having to worry about the Teras Pharma, there is also trouble brewing between the Ionian Empire and those who they deem as rebels. the Vermilion Axe.

One day the young man was out with his friends, the siblings Myrna and Zeno, when they get attacked by some hostile creatures. Fleeing from the monsters they find a hiding place where they are then met by a young man named Xephon. Xephon hands them a mysterious object and when they are told to touch a tree they are then transported back in time where they meet their ancestors who want to travel to the present time to help rid that future world of the incoming Teras Pharma. However the ancestors are not able to transport to the future time so the young swordsman asks his ancestors to take him under their wing and train him so he can rid the world of the Teras Pharma.

Genso Suikoden: Tsumugareshi Hyakunen no Toki is a Suikoden game taking place in a universe outside the main canon Suikoden series, The game doesn't have random encounters as the player can see the enemies on screen and can usually choose when they want to enter into a turn based battle with an enemy or not. The turned based battle system retains the six party member standard of the earlier Suikoden games. In battle, the six party members can be placed in either the front, middle,or back row.with up to three characters per row. The game also offers a rudimentary job class system. For example, if the player wants to use a healing spell they will need a character who is a herbalist The nine main jobs are Spearman, Martialist, Swordsman, Archer, Ninja, Herbalist Jongleur, Magician and Shaman. It's also possible for a character of one class to teach a character a skill of the same class (ie. A swordsman can teach another swordsman any skills they have learned). Most characters can also learn one additional job class from another party member which are unlocked through a character friendship system that involves characters dining together repeatedly.

Like in the other Suikoden games, the game lets the player try to recruit 108 characters to their forces. However only 18 characters will become the main playable party members. The rest either teach skills or are workers at the castle headquarters. Towns in this game are explored through menus instead of physically walked through.
title: Genso Suikoden: Tsumugareshi Hyakunen no Toki

description: KAZooK is a comedic party game composed out of 30 mini-games, including a dancing rhythm game, kart racing, zombie shooting, and more. Completing the mini-games nets money, according to the place on the leaderboard, which is used to unlock new games and characters. Sixteen characters in total are available, including rappers, sumo wrestlers, goth kids and others. Three solo play modes are included: Survival, Practice and Party Superstar.
title: KAZooK

description: This sequel to 7th Dragon takes the same basic game structure and moves it to a near-future setting. Like the original game, players control guilds of custom-created characters in a mission-based structure. In this game, the character classes have been updated to reflect the contemporary setting.
title: 7th Dragon 2020

description: This sequel to 7th Dragon 2020 keeps its near-future fantasy setting. Like the previous game, players control guilds of custom-created characters in a mission-based structure; the character classes reflect the contemporary setting.
title: 7th Dragon 2020-II

description: Harukaze no Kagayaki (春風の輝き) is a downloadable content for Tokimeki Memorial 4 which adds new opening movie for the game.
title: Tokimeki Memorial 4: Opening Movie 'Harukaze no Kagayaki'

description: Futari no Mirai (二人の未来) is a downloadable content for Tokimeki Memorial 4 which adds new ending song for the game.
title: Tokimeki Memorial 4: Sweet Ending Song 'Futari no Mirai'

description: Dragonball Evolution is a fighting game based on the 2009 live action movie adaptation of the Dragon Ball franchise. Featuring the major characters from the film, players have the option of playing a Story mode that recounts the events of the motion picture as Goku fights to keep the wish-granting Dragon Balls out of the hands of the alien menace Piccolo, an Arcade mode where each character faces multiple opponents in a row, and a Survival mode where they fight multiple until they lose. Players also have the option to take their battles online, utilizing combos of regular attacks as well as Ki based special moves and even ultimate attacks.

sample_screenshots.caption: Both the Story and Arcade mode feature cutscenes and dialogues.
After every match we get a ranking and money to spend.
Get ready for the next battle!

title: Dragonball: Evolution

description:
This free PSP Go-exclusive version of Rock Band Unplugged was released as a free voucher included with the PSP Go. It includes five tracks built-in, but is compatible with all of the DLC from the full Rock Band Unplugged game. The included tracks are:

  • Jackson 5 - ABC
  • Motörhead - Ace of Spades
  • Weezer - Buddy Holly
  • Foo Fighters - Everlong
  • Blink 182 - What's My Age Again?
title: Rock Band Unplugged Lite

description:
Scarface: Money. Power. Respect. is a turn-based strategy game based on the 1983 movie Scarface. Players need to manage their drugs business and expand their turf to rule and expand the drug trade in Miami, just like the movie. The game can be played in a single-player mode, either as scenarios from the movie or as a cartel challenge managing one of several unlockable cartels. Each scenario has different objectives such as gathering wealth, building a certain amount of structures or taking over rivals. Usually there is a main goal with several, optional secondary goals. The movie scenarios are interspersed with clips from the movie.

Most of the game is played on a single, fixed-screen where a map of the environment is shown, divided into different turfs with colours signalling whom it belongs to. Players interact through different menu structures as each round goes to three phases. The buy phase is used to hire thugs to fight or pushers to distribute, while constructing buildings such as labs and warehouses. Next is the power moves. These are advantages that can be bought in the areas of combat, drugs and law to influence the odds and apply pressure. The final planning phase is the dealing phase where the drugs is sold, based on the pushers and the structures of the first phase. This is done by going through the available turfs and determining where and what to sell (cocaine, heroin, pot) and which amount.

There is also a combat phase to the game as a final step as players decide to either invade a neighboring cartel or defend. Unlike the rest of the game the execution of the combat phase is shown in a full 3D environment showing the fighting thugs as the camera swings around automatically to show the action. The combat is turn-based and player interaction is limited to attacking, defending or using power moves. Power moves can turn around a disadvantageous position for instance by providing grenade launchers or hiring snipers. Other option are setting car bombs, killing reinforcements or preventing the enemy from calling in reinforcements. In the planning phase it also possible to offer an alliance to a rival player.

The multiplayer gameplay is similar, but played between friends each representing a different cartel. Each cartel is different based on three statistics. Like in the single-player cartel challenges it starts with players taking turns selecting the different turfs on the map at the start of the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: A cartel challenge starts with a land grab to determine the starting turfs.
Choose what to do in combat.

title: Scarface: Money. Power. Respect.

description: The biggest difference of Tiger Woods PGA Tour 07 compared to its predecessor is the new season mode called PGA Season. Here the player created a new golfer and plays through a number of golf events, par-3 challenges and mini games. The earned money can be reinvested into golf gear which improves the golfer's skills. In addition to this mode, there is multiplayer and a number of mini games. There are overall 12 courses and 11 licensed golfers.
title: Tiger Woods PGA Tour 07

description:
Wangan Midnight Portable is a racing game based on the Wangan Midnight manga. Game modes include Arcade, Scenario, Time Attack, Tuning and VS.

In the Arcade mode the players roams around freely. When an opponent is encountered the game enters a battle mode and the cars start to race each other. Each car has a life gauge, shown as a meter, that is drained for the trailing car. The race is over when time runs out or when one of the cars loses all meter. In Scenario mode there are specific rivals to beat, divided over twelve series, interspersed with story sequences based on the manga. The VS mode offers multiplayer games with up to four racers simultaneously, as a race or a time trial. In Tuning the player participates in challenges to earn additional parts. There is also a Replay Theater where replays of races can be viewed.

The game contains licensed cars from the manufacturers Mazda, Mitsubishi, Nissan, Subaru and Toyota, as well as a number of Custom and Special cars. Next to paint kits cars have customization options for body color, body parts, bonnet, rear spoiler, and wheels.

sample_screenshots.caption: Progress through the series in the Scenario mode
Select a game mode in the main menu
Story sequence in the Scenario mode
Racing against an opponent in the Arcade mode

title: Wangan Midnight Portable

description:
Blood Bowl is an adaptation of the table-top miniature-based game of the same name. It is played as a turn-based strategy game played as a American football-style fantasy sports title and is different from the releases for other platforms. You control a team of sixteen players, of which eleven are allowed on the pitch at any time. The goal is to get the ball over your opponent's touchdown line either by running it into the end zone or throwing it to someone who catches it there. There are eight races each with their own units and tactics: Chaos, Dwarf, Goblin, Human, Lizardmen, Orc, Skaven and Wood Elf.

The single-player game modes include a Quick Game option using 56 pre-set teams, and the main Championship option which has you playing your way through fifteen tournaments. The multi-player game modes are Wireless/Ad-Hoc two-player games or a Hotseat mode where both player share a single device taking turns. As you do this, you build up your own team of unique players, which you can save out for local Wi-Fi head-to-head multiplayer or Cup and League games against the computer.

In addition, inducements allow you to set up dirty tactics for the match. Using your cash you can bribe refs to gain extra dice rolls. Potions can be bought, which are Blood Bowl’s version of drugs, and to give yourself bonuses you can hire crowds to cheer for you. All these affect the outcome of dice rolls.
title: Blood Bowl

description: A handheld version of Avatar: The Last Airbender. It follows the same general story and game flow, but it has it's own unique design and a more simplified feeling. For instance instead of being able to have three other characters follow Aang around only one other character can follow him at a time.
title: Avatar: The Last Airbender

description: Naruto Shippuden: Legends: Akatsuki Rising is a video game set within the Part II arc of the Naruto anime series. It was never released in Japan. It serves as a sequel to Naruto: Uzumaki Chronicles 2 and covers the Kazekage Rescue Mission. Naruto and his companions go on an adventure to save the Fifth Kazekage, Gaara, from the shinobi group Akatsuki.
title: Naruto Shippuden: Legends - Akatsuki Rising
Frontier Gate: Christmas Equipment "Akai Borias Zoku"
Frontier Gate: Christmas Equipment "Tonakai no Kigurumi"
Frontier Gate: Gossipword "Hisomu Dennsetu no Hakaisya"

description:
Dai-2-ji Super Robot Taisen Z Saisei-hen is the second part of the sequel to the 2008 PS2 title Super Robot Wars Z following the first part Dai-2-Ji Super Robot Taisen Z Hakai-hen.

Despite the efforts of our heroes to end terrorist activity and all conflict on Earth in the first game, the Dimensional Monsters, rampaging hordes that destroy everything in their path, have been spawning more and more. Meanwhile, the new world order, established under the Earth Federation and its elite forces, the A-LAWS (from Mobile Suit Gundam 00 Second Season), shows no mercy to any dissident groups or rogue nations. A rebellion is brewing across the entire globe, as humanity tries to solve the crisis. Crow Burst, after witnessing the return of the Dimensional Monsters (as well as a new debt that he has to pay off), he embarks on a quest that will instigate a worldwide rebellion, and, potentially, get to the bottom of this prolonged conflict.

This game continues the story from Dai-2-Ji Super Robot Taisen Z Hakai-hen. The game allows players to import their character and their completed save file to gain money bonuses as well as the opportunity to unlock secret levels, in a similar fashion to Super Robot Taisen: Compact 2 for the WonderSwan. It features a longer campaign than the previous part (60 levels compared to 50 in the previous game). The gameplay and its system, however, is pretty much the same as the previous part.
title: Dai-2-ji Super Robot Taisen Z Saisei-hen
The iDOLM@STER SP: Wristband of Note
The iDOLM@STER SP: Watashi ha Idol -RMX- (Rivals)
The iDOLM@STER SP: Watashi ha Idol -RMX-

description: Kaori Sawai, a young nurse, is pursuing her dream career as a way of paying back the doctors who saved her as a young child. She had no idea, however, that her dream of helping patients would lead her to true love... This lesbian romance visual novel is story-focused, and features multiple branching endings with a variety of love interests. It was followed up shortly after release with a rerelease titled Re:Therapy which features updated content and a new love interest.
title: White Robe Love Syndrome

description: Ys vs. Sora no Kiseki: Alternative Saga is a crossover fighting game. It involves characters from both the Ys series and the Legend of Heroes series. The game mixes JRPG elements and fighting elements together while having a Story Mode involving various fights. The game takes place in the kingdom of Xanadu.
title: Ys vs. Sora no Kiseki: Alternative Saga

description:
Dark forces that threatened to destroy the world of La Gias have rescinded, if only for a brief. While the conflicts have been resolved, the Holy Kingdom of Langran is facing another war, this time with a new force: The Republic of Baronia. Forging an alliance with a long-time enemy of Langran, their goal is simple: to see the kingdom burn. In the midst of this new, twisted conflict, Masaki Andō and his team of Elemental Lords become independent from their previous masters, and form their own force to combat threats that can ravage the world of La Gias. Now, they venture out to find out what caused this new conflict to erupt.

After 16 years, the original Masou Kishin game finally receives a sequel. Like its predecessor and most of the games in the long-running Super Robot Wars/Taisen franchise, the game is a tactical RPG in a science-fantasy setting. Players control characters that pilot "Elemental Lords", robots with magical powers, powered by their pilot's prāna, or life force. The main objectives are to defeat enemies and progress through the story, often with branching paths that can impact the final outcome.

Once again, the terrain plays an important role in tactics. Terrain differences, as well as unit positions can impact the outcome of a battle. Units that attack other units from side or from back deal greater damage. While the combat system remains relatively unchanged, few elements were added from the main Super Robot Wars/Taisen franchise. For example, combined attacks to the enemy are now possible and they net both the main attacker and their partner experience points. Another one is the addition of assist attacks and defenses. If an allied unit possesses such skills, they can assist their friendly units when they are adjacent to them. However, their use is limited and so must be used wisely.
title: Super Robot Taisen OG Saga: Masou Kishin II - The Revelation of Evil God

description:
A limited edition bundle pack that includes the following games:

  • Super Robot Taisen OG Saga: Masou Kishin - The Lord of Elemental
  • Super Robot Taisen OG Saga: Masou Kishin II - The Revelation of Evil God
title: Super Robot Taisen OG Saga: Masou Kishin I & II

description:
R-Type Tactics II: Operation Bitter Chocolate is a turn-based strategy tactical role-playing game and the sequel to R-Type Tactics as a spin-off of the main R-Type 2D side-scrolling arcade shooter series. The levels are structured as a side-scrolling shooter and the units of the two factions are placed on both sides of the hexagonal field. The fields are often larger than in the first game, can take place in large space facilities, and some of them have vertically scrolling stages. The opponents take turns instructing the units, with an important element that units cannot be turned around and can only attack in the direction they face. Not all matches have the player start on the left.

At the start of the game the player creates a custom commander based on a number of parameters (gender, silhouette, birth place, favorite color, favorite food) and then takes on one of the three campaigns. Each campaign is based on a different faction. There is the first human faction, EAAF (Earth Allied Armed Forces), as an evolution of the Earth Space Corps in the first game, the second human faction, Granzera Revolutionary Army (GZRA), entirely new for this game and hailing from a base in Mars, and the alien Bydo Empire. The two human campaigns need to be completed first. Profiles from the first game can be carried over and are used for the Bydo campaign.

Each faction has different units and abilities. The EAAF, for instance, has chosen to develop Force weapons based on Bydo alien technology, while the opposing revolutionary GZRA faction warns against the dependency on alien technology and use techniques such as Capture, Jamming (fog of war as masking) and Sonar (reveal de-synched units moving in subspace) instead of Force. This conflict between the two human factions is the main storyline and the game takes place in MC 0074, ten years after the events of the first game. This game features branching mission paths unlocked through choices in the journal.

The game contains more than 200 different units often from existing R-Type titles such as R-Type Final and even In the Hunt. Each unit has specific statistics based on movement options, fuel, move cost, evasion rate, ammo, power, range, accuracy and so on. There are also unique abilities for base movement and attacks. Long-lasting units earn veterancy levels, which improve hit points or evasion levels. The EAAF's Force units are controlled separately or can attach themselves to other crafts. Along the way, new abilities are acquired making new units and upgrades available. New units are also provided after completing specific objectives, usually capturing structures. Progress is shown on a technology tree and certain very strong upgrades are available through DLC. Not all battles are limited to attacks, certain units can build space stations with a complex module system of up to 30 elements such as turrets, radars, docking bays, etc. These modules are tied to core blocks and once when of those is destroyed the entire station blows up.

Almost all units can eventually be unlocked, including those of other factions. Players can also choose to leave missions early, taking the spoils gathered so far to run. Multiplayer is supported in competitive matches over Wi-Fi next to a cooperative two-player mode using Game Sharing and an ad hoc connection.

sample_screenshots.caption: The main management screen before going into battle
The commander's journal where certain choices can be made.

title: R-Type Tactics II: Operation Bitter Chocolate

description:
Nendoroland, a world unlike our own. For years, the various characters have lived in peace and prosperity. However, one day, at a Nendoro Academy, an unknown event happens that causes people to become overflowing with sadness and anger. A lone heroine, Black Rock Shooter, along with other companions from all over their world, embark on a quest that will change their world forever.

Nendoroid Generation is a crossover Japanese RPG game, based on the toy line by Good Smile Company, that produces SD (super-deformed) or chibi versions of characters from popular anime, manga and game franchises. It is a straightforward Japanese RPG, with simple gameplay and mechanics. Players control their party of three characters: 2 main characters, divided into melee or ranged, and a "performer", that can help the party by giving stat boosts during a battle. Players control their party members, wander around levels, collect items, talk to people and complete quests that progress the story. Combat is initiated through random encounters.

There are two interesting gimmicks to the genre. The first one is the "crystal" system. Crystals represent character's willpower. Each attack or move consumes some part of them. When they reach zero, characters suffer a "crash" and are incredibly vulnerable to enemy attack. To replenish them, performers can perform dances that give them the necessary energy to fight again. Another system is the costume system. By defeating enemies with an all-out attack, players receive costumes or other pieces of clothing that upgrades their party's stats, as well as provide a rich variety of customization. The game has a very lighthearted and humorous tone.
title: Nendoroid Generation

description:
Football Manager Handheld 2012 is the PSP version of the annual Football Manager series and as with the PSP Handheld releases of the previous years, it offers a stripped-down experience of the main PC version. It is also different from the Android / iOS title Football Manager Handheld 2012, which has more content than this PSP version.

The game offers control of a selection of 50 clubs from all over the world with some major ones, but not all squads are complete or entirely accurate. The basic simulation focuses on the team selection, trainings and preparations, transfers, contracts and scouting, and in-game tactics. Additional depth to the strategy is provided through a boardroom, and player and media interaction. At some stages the conversations and decisions can be steered by selecting from five options that influence the talks.

The simulation of the games is provided through a 3D engine. Improvements are introduced through the interaction with the media, social networking, friendly games and international management.
title: Football Manager Handheld 2012

description: Yukiwari no Hana is the final game in the Yarudora series which was also converted from PlayStation to PSP platform and follows the same principle as the previous games in a series, that of being an interactive 2D anime with multiple choices that branch the story. Out of the four games in the series which center around the similar story premise but differ in season. This game's story takes place during winter.
title: Yukiwari no Hana

description: This box set contains the Capukore budget re-releases of both Rockman Dash and Rockman Dash 2.
title: Rockman Dash + Rockman Dash 2 Value Pack

description:
Yu-Gi-Oh GX: Tag Force 2 is the second game in the Tag Force series and is based on the Yu-Gi-Oh TCG card game. It is also based on the second season of the anime series Yu-Gi-Oh GX. It is set at the beginning of your character's second year at the academy, following the events of the original Tag Force.

This game covers the Society of Light storyline while also intertwining it with a Tag Team tournament. You choose from several characters (three at the start with more unlocked as you play), duel alongside them, talk to them and give them gifts to raise the amount of hearts (each heart unlocks a story event).
title: Yu-Gi-Oh GX: Tag Force 2

description:
Freeshot Frenzy is a video game adaptation of the amusement arcade game where players try to shoot as many basketballs as possible through a hoop.

The game has an Arcade mode, Impulsive mode, and Go Frenzy mode. In the Arcade mode the hoop is stationary and the player has to shoot as make as many baskets as they can in a limited amount of time. In the Impulsive mode, the hoop now moves around, but the player now has more time to shoot than in the arcade mode. The Go Frenzy modes a mix of both modes with the shorter time of the Arcade mode and with the moving hoop of the Impulsive mode.

The game is played by the having the player control a pair of disembodied hands to pick up a basketball and then aim and throw it. The amount of force the ball is thrown with is determined by where the player stops a marker on a force meter.
title: Free Shot Frenzy

description:
Crimson Room features ports of the following flash games:

  • Crimson Room
  • Viridian Room
  • Blue Chamber
  • White Chamber

On top of that, the game offers four more additional room puzzles to solve. These rooms will appear similar to to those above mentioned rooms but the way to escape these rooms has been changed.
title: Crimson Room Reverse

description: A followup to Success's earlier Numpla Advance for the Game Boy Advance, Numpla 10000-mon allows players to challenge any of 10,000 different sudoku puzzles. Puzzles are grouped into difficulty levels, each containing 2000 problems, to help guide players. A tutorial is also provided to help players learn how to solve puzzles. An editor mode lets players create their own puzzles.
title: Numpla 10000-mon

description:
Adventure Player is FromSoftware's application made to allow gamers to create their own Japanese Adventure games, visual novels and quiz games for their PSP.

Players can transfer their games into a Memory Stick Duo card to share and play, as well as upload their games online.

The software has three games built-in for players to try:* Kaikiken

  • Echo Night #1
  • Hako No Naka

The first game is a visual novel that consists of 3 short stories, while the other two are Japanese Adventure games.

Additional games could be purchased at FromSoftware's Nouten website.
title: Adventure Player

description: Another Century's Episode Portable is a portable version of the Another Century's Episode series. The game combines elements of its four predecessors, with the gameplay being more reminiscent to the PlayStation 2 games. There is no plot; the game operates more like a mission simulator. Elements brought back include the old functional boost. The game also contains squad multiplayer.
title: Another Century's Episode Portable

description: Win-JPT is a beginner's language learning tool designed to allow Korean-speakers to learn Japanese. It features beginner-oriented lessons to allow learners to learn simple vocabulary and sentences, enhanced with spoken recordings, and it features a variety of interactive quiz games to test learners' comprehension.
title: Win-JPT Ilbon-eo Chogeub

description: Mutajuice is the first foray into game development by Korean CG animation studio Cinepix, known for the TV series AquaKids and Cubix. Taking place in a fantastical sci-fi world, it follows a member of OOPS - the Office of Planetary Security, a government branch responsible for defending Earth against alien invasions. Luckily they have the power of Mutajuice on their side, which enables them to pilot giant robots with incredible super powers. The protagonist ends up encountering enemies who plan to harness Mutajuice for their own evil ends, and so teams up with other OOPS heroes to battle them for the fate of the world. This interactive film is structured in the multiple-path adventure style, like 90s CD-ROM FMV games. Players have little interaction moment to moment; instead, the player's main impact comes in several different multiple-choice branching pathways that come up throughout the film, with the player's choice directing the story onto a new path. Based on the choices made, there are a number of different ways the story can play out and several different possible endings.
title: Mutajuice

description: SD Gundam G Generation Overworld is a strategy role-playing game and it is the sequel to SD Gundam G Generation 3D. The game introduces new features and enhanced visuals that were not in the previous version, such as the addition of World Core in the Top Menu, Master Pilots now being able to cast their own unique skills, an improved character creation system, the ability to insert own custom BGM, new featured series debuts such as from Gunpla Builders Beginnings G while others like Sangokuden Brave Battle Warriors in World are entirely left out, and more.
title: SD Gundam G Generation Overworld

description:
Eloquent Fist is a 2D side-scrolling beat 'em up based on the Ikkitōsen high school manga franchise created by Yuji Shiozaki. The gameplay combines typical beat-'em-up gameplay fighting multiple enemies and many cut-scenes between the fights that further the story about turf wars between rival schools.

In the main Story mode one of three plotlines is followed, each following different schools and often switching the playable character between scenes. The characters' health and special meters can be upgraded. In the Arcade mode you pick one character and fight through seven stages.
title: Ikkitōsen: Eloquent Fist

description: Xross Impact is the third game based on the Ikkitōsen manga franchise. Like its predecessor, it is a side-scrolling beat-'em-up with RPG elements. In the game, players choose two characters to play as, one at a time. One chose playable character can be swapped for the other one during gameplay.
title: Ikkitōsen: Xross Impact

description:
Brothers Conflict: Brilliant Blue is a dating simulator set in Japan. It is one of Otomate's two games in the series, the other being Brothers Conflict: Passion Pink. The difference between the two games is that owing to the numerous choices and prospects, the various love interests you may have are different.

Hinata Ema is a sixteen-year-old girl who has spent the most of her youth living alone. She has lived alone with her father, Hinata Rintaro, since she was a child because of his career as a famous adventurer, which takes him all over the world. Her father had recently gotten engaged to a woman called Asahina Miwa, and Ema was expecting thirteen siblings as a result. However, as the siblings and Ema get to know one other, the brothers, who are all male, develop love for her despite the fact that she is their new "sister."
title: Brothers Conflict: Brilliant Blue

description:
Brothers Conflict: Passion Pink is a dating simulator set in Japan. It is one of Otomate's two games in the series, the other being Brothers Conflict: Brilliant Blue. The difference between the two games is that owing to the numerous choices and prospects, the various love interests you may have are different.

Hinata Ema is the daughter of Hinata Rintarou, a well-known explorer. Ema learns one day that her father is remarrying to Asahina Miwa, a successful clothes designer. Rather than troubling them, she decides to relocate to Miwa's Sunrise Residence complex. She learns that she has 13 stepbrothers after that. Will one of Ema's step-brothers fall in love with her as she gets to know them all?
title: Brothers Conflict: Passion Pink

description: Diamond and The sound of a Gun shot is a negotiation adventure novel. While playing this game, the player plays the part of Onizuka Yōichi, a freelance negotiator who studied negotiations in New York City Police Department. The in-game negotiation system runs in real time, thus player need to press the right button at the right time to choose appropriate words to say to the negotiating opponent.
title: Diamond and The Sound of a Gun Shot

alternate_titles.title: Die Legende von Beowulf: Das Spiel
La Leggenda di Beowulf: Il Videogioco
La Légende de Beowulf: Le Jeu

description: Fate/Extra is a role-playing game with a turn-based battle system. The game is set in a futuristic school where 128 people are fighting in a battle royale to get the Holy Grail and have their wish granted. The main character has lost their memories and is trying to uncover them and learn more about the world. The gameplay consists of running around talking to people in a visual novel style presentation and dialogue, gathering information about the other contestants and then moving into a dungeon crawling section where you fight enemies using a rock-paper-scissors combat and learning attack patterns of enemies to reveal their potential moves.
title: Fate/Extra

description:
Madoka Kaname: a middle-schooler who was offered a contract to become a magical girl and fight witches, not realizing that magical girldom is nothing more than suffering, pain and despair.

Sayaka Miki: her best friend, who contracted and succumbed to said despair and became a witch.

Kyoko Sakura: a veteran who lost her family to a murder-suicide after contracting.

Mami Tomoe: a magical girl who made the ultimate sacrifice for her cause.

And Homura Akemi: a time-traveling magical girl who has been trying over and over again to stop Madoka from contracting and bringing about disaster to the world.

Together, their paths have crossed countless times in countless timelines, and every time the results have been more or less the same. Time and again, the results of their collective actions have resulted in Madoka dying, Madoka turning into a witch, the world falling into chaos, or other such calamities. And yet, there still remains that one distinct possibility that somehow, somewhere, one little action can change the future...

Based on the anime/manga series "Puella Magi Madoka Magica", Puella Magi Madoka Magica Portable puts a single player in control of the 5 main characters from the series, as they battle against dungeons and witches alike. In between the dungeons, the action shifts to a visual novel style, where the actions taken (mostly as Kyubey, but sometimes as Homura) can change the magical girl's fighting and/or mood. Each girl has their own route, with different branching paths depending on the actions taken. These actions, combined with the stats of the girls, can help change their fate for the better... or for worse!
title: Puella Magi Madoka Magica Portable

alternate_titles.title: Copa Mundial de la FIFA Sudáfrica 2010
Coupe du Monde de la FIFA, Afrique du Sud 2010

description:
Atari Classics Evolved is a compilation of eleven classic arcade games from Atari. Each comes in two varieties: an emulation of the original arcade game and an "evolved" version with enhanced graphics and sound. Some of the "evolved" versions had previously been available as stand-alone titles on Xbox Live Arcade.

Games included are:

  • Asteroids
  • Asteroids Deluxe
  • Battlezone
  • Centipede
  • Lunar Lander
  • Millipede
  • Missile Command
  • Pong
  • Super Breakout
  • Tempest
  • Warlords

Each game has four different awards to win by achieving certain feats. Winning all of them unlocks a collection of more than 50 Atari 2600 games to play.
title: Atari Classics Evolved

alternate_titles.title: Ponkotsu Roman Daikatsugeki: Bumpy Trot - Vehicle Battle Tournament
Simple 2500 Series Portable!! Vol. 2: The Tennis
Practical IQ: Prova la Tua Intelligenza!

title: Patito Feo: El juego más bonito

Mega Minis Volume 1 is a retail compilation of five games previously available as downloads from PlayStation Network:

  • Pinball Fantasies
  • Spot the Differences
  • YetiSports
  • Zombie Tycoon
  • Vibes
title: Mega Minis: Volume 1

description:
Mega Minis Volume 3 is a retail compilation of five games previously available as downloads from PlayStation Network:

  • Arcade Air Hockey and Bowling
  • Archibald's Adventures
  • Breakquest
  • Who's That Flying?!
  • Ice Road Truckers
title: Mega Minis: Volume 3

description:
Race Driver 2006 is the American release of TOCA Race Driver 2, and expands upon the original version with the following new content:

  • 10 new tracks, including Nashville and Shanghai
  • 16 new cars, including the Pontiac Firebird 400, Dodge Charger and Gemballa GTR 750 EVO
  • a new single player mode called "Trans World Cup", which is a series of challenges including standard races, duels, time trials, no-damage runs and more
title: Race Driver 2006

alternate_titles.title: New Rainbow Islands: Hurdy Gurdy Daibōken!!

description: This compilation contains two games previously released for PlayStation and Dreamcast: World Neverland: The Olerud Kingdom Stories and World Neverland 2: The Waktic Republic of Pluto.
title: World Neverland 2 in 1 Portable: Olerud Kingdom & Republic of Pluto

description: Skate Park City is a futuristic skating game. The player controls a skater who needs to rescue his friends that have been kidnapped by the rival skater Virus. At the start of the game one of two characters is selected, Jalice or Ching, with different statistics for energy, adrenaline, speed, jump and grind. In different locations missions need to be completed based around performing tricks. There is fast gameplay similar to the Tony Hawk skateboarding series.
title: Skate Park City

description: DJMax Portable: Clazziquai Edition is a music game and the third title for the PSP in the DJMax Portable series after DJMax Portable 2. The game features songs from the Korean band Clazziquai.
title: DJMax Portable: Clazziquai Edition

description: DJMax Portabl: Black Square is a music game and the fourth title in the DJMax series released for the PSP. The game includes various enhancements and new features built on from DJMax Portable 2 and DJMax Portable: Clazziquai Edition.
title: DJMax Portable: Black Square

description: This updated reissue of Kaitō Apricot includes all content from the previous Complete Edition, and also adds a new additional scenario unique to this version along with an unlockable art gallery.
title: Kaitō Apricot Portable

description: Project Cerberus is a 2D fighting game based on the visual novel Lost Child, developed by tama-soft. Set in a dark futuristic horror setting, it features a cast of 14 characters who have taken on monstrous abilities in order to fight back against monsters who are threatening the world. Like many other fighting games in that era, it follows the "anime fighter" mold, with flexibility to string moves together and create long combos.
title: Project Cerberus

description: Airou de Puzzle is a spinoff of Capcom's Monster Hunter series starring the adorable airou (felyne) helpers. This time around, battles happen on the puzzle field: it adapts the rules of Capcom's Super Puzzle Fighter II Turbo, with one-on-one puzzle fights starring a variety of airou characters.
title: Airou de Puzzle
